author: agnxsh
content: there seems to be still some issues with the nimbus full node, investigating

author: agnxsh
content: were there any forks, and then recoveries?

author: g11tech
content: one question: while syncing by range, does one require sampled columns or custody columns

author: agnxsh
content: i believe max(SAMPLES_PER_SLOT, custody), so basically sampled columns

author: agnxsh
content: why can't we just bump CUSTODY_REQUIREMENT to 8, if we are subscribing 8 subnets as full node? correct me if i am wrong

author: g11tech
content: i guess to bump SAMPLES_PER_SLOT to even higher count if we don't get stable devnets to a point when its stable enough

author: g11tech
content: lodestar is now also uptodate on subnet sampling in its latest image, if anyone wanna test/use it

author: g11tech
content:
for supernode:

```yaml
  - cl_type: lodestar
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lodestar:peerDAS
    cl_extra_params: [--persistNetworkIdentity, --supernode]
```

author: g11tech
content:
for full node: 
```yaml
  - cl_type: lodestar
    cl_image: ethpandaops/lodestar:peerDAS
    cl_extra_params: [--persistNetworkIdentity]
```

author: g11tech
content: in the mean time we are running our own kurtosis muli client tests

author: agnxsh
content: i am at epoch 4, i had 1 super lodestar, 1 super prysm and 1 super nimbus, 1 full nodes for each, the network is really stable, however, due to some cpu util issue i guess, my super nimbus container shut down suddenly, there are no forks at all, and full nimbus seems to be coherent with the lodestar x prysm view.

author: agnxsh
content: i had 9 logical cores allocated for docker in general.
